question: What is the net magnetic field in a solenoid?
option1: product of the fields due to all the turns
option2: equal to the field due to the largest turn
option3: vector sum of the fields due to all the turns
option4: arithmetic mean of the fields due to all the turns
answer: vector sum of the fields due to all the turns
explanation: The net magnetic field in a solenoid is the vector sum of the fields due to all the turns.
